meanings.definition: To grant a special advantage or favor to someone.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was privileging the top students with extra study materials.
meanings.sent2: She was privileging her best friend by inviting her to the exclusive party.
meanings.sent3: The cat was privileging the new toy over the old ones.
meanings.sent4: The company was privileging efficiency above all other factors.
meanings.sent5: The king was privileging the knight with a shiny new armor.

meanings.definition: To prioritize or give preference to something or someone.
meanings.sent1: The manager was privileging customer satisfaction over profit margins.
meanings.sent2: He was privileging his health by choosing to exercise regularly.
meanings.sent3: The robot was privileging speed over accuracy in its tasks.
meanings.sent4: She was privileging comfort when selecting her outfit for the day.
meanings.sent5: The coach was privileging teamwork in building a strong bond among the players.

meanings.definition: To treat someone or something as more important or valuable.
meanings.sent1: The parents were privileging their child's education above all else.
meanings.sent2: The museum was privileging the rare artifact in its exhibition.
meanings.sent3: The chef was privileging presentation over taste in the dish.
meanings.sent4: She was privileging her pet's comfort by buying a luxurious bed.
meanings.sent5: The professor was privileging critical thinking skills in his lectures.
